title: How to Use Halo Weapon Tactics

steps.headline: Use the Assault Rifle at short to mid range.
Drain the enemy's shields.
steps.description: When an enemy comes rushing up to you just unload your assault rifle's magazine on him/her. This will lower their shields and create enough damage to your opponent for your kill shot. Quickly change to your secondary weapon and finish the kill. Strike your opponent when their shield and health is down. It only takes one melee strike from your weapon to kill most opponents.

steps.headline: Go up to your enemy and melee them which will lower their shields.
steps.description: After that just shoot them. It only takes about roughly 23-27 bullets to kills a Spartan with full shields, and about 13-20 bullets to kill one with their shields down.

steps.headline: Shoot in short controlled bursts (3 rounds).
steps.description: If you are shooting from medium range with the Assault Rifle shoot in short bursts. It will kept recoil to a minimum while retaining accuracy and saving your ammo.

steps.headline: Zoom in and scan the area around you for enemies to shoot at.
Shoot the enemy when someone is charging at you.
steps.description: More than likely if your enemy does not have a DMR then you have the advantage in most cases because the DMR only takes five shoots to kill a Spartan III and six to kill an Elite (assuming the last shot was a headshot). Just unload until his/her shields are down and get the headshot.

steps.headline: Zoom in and take a look around if you see an enemy at medium to long range.
steps.description: Then start shooting them. Pace your shots. Wait 1 second after each shot to let your reticle reset then shoot again and again until there shields are down.

steps.headline: Shoot the enemy if you see him and he is close to you.
Pull out your rocket launcher and wait until the reticle turns red.
steps.description: When it does wait a few more seconds and then a diamond/square shape box will appear that means you are locked on. When this happens, shoot a single rocket (as it only requires one to kill). Then, if you're unsuccessful, keep the target locked on and fire again.

steps.headline: Shoot your weapon, making sure to lead the target.
steps.description: If they are moving, aim up to account for the drop. Note: The grenade will bounce and could come back and end up hurting or killing you. Becoming extremely accurate with this gun while using this basic fire mode will make you deadly as the Grenade Launcher is available on a large percentage of the maps, and is a starting weapon for Stage 3 Invasion.

steps.headline: Hold in your firing trigger.
steps.description: This allows you to be in a hiding place and shoot your Grenade Launcher. When someone comes close to your grenade, just release the firing button and you either have a kill or have injured your opponent. The Grenade Launcher also releases an EMP with this method, disabling  vehicles temporarily to allow to to run away or board/destroy.

steps.headline: Practice offline with friends locally before you pick up a sniper rifle.
steps.description: This will allow you to get a feeling of how to use the sniper rifle. So if you see a sniper rifle laying on the ground in multiplayer match making let a more experienced person with this weapon have it!

steps.headline: Try to go for the headshot.
Use Sniper Rifle as a last-ditch defense against vehicles.
steps.description: Note: This is not recommended as it is a waste of ammo and takes many hits to destroy a vehicle.

steps.headline: Use any other weapon for an example.
steps.description: Use your Assault Rifle and shoot at your enemy until their shields are down and pull out your pistol and shoot them in the head and you have a kill.

steps.headline: Time your shots.
steps.description: Making sure for the reticle doesn't not expand. It will take 5 shots to kill (4 to take down shields, last one for the unshielded head).

steps.headline: Shoot your enemy when his shields fall.
steps.description: Shoot him/her in the body three times and the result will be a super combine explosion.

steps.headline: Shoot them in the head.
steps.description: When you get your enemy's shields down you can just try a headshot.

steps.headline: Hold fire down.
steps.description: In "Title-Updated" gametypes holding fire down will cause the Needler to fire much faster and will not loose any accuracy if you are stationary.

steps.headline: Lock on to anyone as your are about to die.
steps.description: You only need to shoot one Plasma Launcher round to kill a Spartan or Elite. So shoot only as you are about to die. So that way not only did they kill you but you also killed them and you got a "Kill From The Grave Metal".

steps.headline: Lock on to vehicles.
steps.description: Plus it homes in on your target so lock on to any vehicle and wait until all four shots are charged up then shoot it will home in on your target (this goes for players too). Note: If an enemy goes behind a wall most likely your charges will miss.

steps.headline: Pick it up.
steps.description: Pretty much you always want to kept this weapon away unless you are trying to kill someone. Having your Energy Sword out actually gives out light which can sometimes give you away.

steps.headline: Be a ninja.
steps.description: Have Active Camo as your ability. Have an Energy Sword ready. When you see a red dot on your radar turn on your Active Camo and when your opponent gets close to you "slash" he's dead. Or you could go for an assassination by going behind them. This will prompt a special assassination animation exclusive to a Spartan holding an Energy Sword.

steps.headline: Find one.
steps.description: It is extremely hard to find a Spartan Laser in most multiplayer.

steps.headline: Stay quite a bit from your target.
steps.description: It takes about a good 3.5 to 5 seconds to charge up your shots.

steps.headline: Try to take out vehicles more then players.
steps.description: This is to help your ground troops out from oncoming vehicles (this applies to campaign also).
